title: What is a Matrix with Zeroes on the Diagonal?
text: A matrix with zeroes on the diagonal refers to a square matrix where all the diagonal entries (from the top left to the bottom right) are zero.

title: Gaussian Elimination
text: If you're using Gaussian elimination, a zero on the diagonal does not automatically make the matrix unsolvable, but it can create challenges. A zero in the diagonal position of a pivot can indicate that the system has no unique solution, or it may require special handling, such as row swapping or using other methods.
